Title: PH - Accountant - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Accountant
Philippines Finance Contract
Before you read any further: Our strength at Opencare relies on the diversity of perspective that we work hard to craft on our team. We are all solving the same set of problems from our own unique lenses, and this is fundamental to our success as a business. Experience means something different to each of us, and your unique combination of skills, passions, and experiences makes you a valuable asset to our team.
Opencare’s Vision
To enable people to have optimal health of mind and body, by ensuring they get the preventive care they need.
Opencare is re-designing the dentist visit with a focus on wellness. We live our most important life moments, from laughing and smiling to eating and talking, through our mouths. Yet for such an important body part, the thought of visiting the dentist instills fear and confusion in most people. To us, that doesn’t make any sense. That’s why we’re rebuilding every moment of the dental experience; not only to be impactful during the visit, but life enriching afterward, too. If you never thought you’d say “Wow, I love my dentist!”, our goal is to get you there.
*
Our Finance Team’s Vision*
In order to achieve our vision, our finance team enables the organization to rapidly iterate and understand the impact of our decisions, to assist our practices in delivering top notch patient experiences. Our finance team spans across the organization and is a key player in such decision making as sales strategy, product & engineering investment, and fundraising.
*
How will you help to get us there?*
As an Accountant, you will be responsible for the accurate recording of the company’s books and reconciling the accounts for a timely monthly close. You will ensure the monthly, quarterly and annual tax filings are submitted and will be responsible for the accounts payables process and reconciliation. You will provide insights for our Manager, Finance to more effectively operate the finance function.
Your impact, six months into the role:
Managing our bookkeeping, account reconciliation process and the month-end closing activities including preparation of journal entries, reconciliation of accounts, sales tax computations, and other accounting duties in a timely manner
Compiling accounts payable information into our tracking sheets and ensuring items are paid and reconciled in our systems, and providing insights into payables
Managing our payment platforms to pay our vendors and contractors in a timely manner
Maintain our banking and treasury functions along with our cash management activities
Working with the people operations team to compile payroll information for reconciliation and entry purposes
Completing tax filings on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis, and assisting with 1099 forms
Your impact, one year into the role:
Analyzing spending and providing recommendations, while conducting analysis on the benefits of alternative options
Collecting inputs from stakeholders across the organization to update our monthly budgets and financial projections
Providing oversight on the accounts receivable function
Drafting financial reports and conducting a variance analysis on a month-to-month basis to guide our decision making
Submitting and complete monthly/quarterly data requests from our investors
Supporting ad-hoc analyses regarding the company’s operations and ROI on spend
What skills will you bring to the team from day one?
Self starter who is looking to take ownership of the day-to-day bookkeeping and reporting inquiries
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage the needs of multiple stakeholders both internally and externally
Critical thinker that want to investigate and ensure items reconcile, and payments are managed appropriately
CPA is nice to have, but not required.
Experience with Xero, Google Sheets, Dext, Plooto considered an asset.
What skills will you have the opportunity to develop?
Working with large data sets to create relevant operational and financial reports and spreadsheets/google sheets
Hands on experience with many different types of resources and tools that raise the bar for efficiency and process improvement
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Remote Full-Cycle Accountant - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Remote Staff Accountant & Client Manager
Talented Staff Accountant wanted for ProfitLine USA's team!
Who We Are
At ProfitLine, we’re providing great outsourced accounting departments to small businesses and non-profit organizations across the US. We believe that managers make better decisions when their organizations’ books are in great shape and their financial processes are strong, so we work hard to provide the support our customers need to succeed and grow.
We’re part of the next generation of outsourced accounting departments, leading the industry forward using best-in-class cloud apps. From our NYC Midtown office (and now remotely), we support a wide range of customers across many industries, including marketing, manufacturing, law, and technology.
About the Role
We are expanding our Cloud Bookkeeping Services Department to accommodate the needs of our clients. We are eager to hire a seasoned bookkeeper who has experience working with multiple clients in a Business Services environment. In addition to advanced accounting knowledge, we are looking for someone who is well versed in accounting software and applications.
Requirements for this position:
· 2+ years experience with QuickBooks Online (QBO) software
· 3+ years experience with bookkeeping for small businesses or non-profits
· Working knowledge of the internal accounting demands of small businesses, such as customer invoicing, accounts receivable management, expense and accounts payable management, account reconciliations, payroll, sales tax remittances, and financial statement preparation
Responsibilities:
· Managing client relationships across a portfolio of clients
· Providing ongoing accounting services, including customer invoicing and accounts receivable management, expense processing, and accounts payable management
· Ensuring transactions are accurately categorized
· Completing monthly bank, credit card, and other account reconciliations
· Completing monthly closes
· Preparing regular financial statements and other financial reports
· Problem solving, addressing and resolving issues effectively and speedily
Qualifications:
· Minimum of 3 years of recent and relevant full-charge bookkeeping experience
· Experience with cloud accounting tools
· Solid understanding of the accounting cycle
· Experience with creating and managing schedules, such as prepaid expense, fixed asset, depreciation, loan and inventory schedules
· Strong written and verbal English communication skills, with customer-facing experience
· Technological optimist, with passion for fintech
· Extremely organized, with excellent attention to detail and proven ability to multi-task
· Bachelor’s degree (preferably in accounting)
Compensation:
$50k to $65k annual salary, plus year-end bonus, with great opportunities for learning and advancement.
